Moving to Runtime since it looks like a class loading issue.

What VM are you using?

Here's my normal JDK:

java version "1.6.0-beta"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.6.0-beta-b59g)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.6.0-beta-b59g, mixed mode, sharing)

===
eclipse.buildId=I20060419-1640
java.version=1.6.0-beta
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86

---------------------------
But I also ran Eclipse using Java 5 to make sure it's not the beta:

===
java version "1.5.0_06"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.5.0_06-b05)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.5.0_06-b05, mixed mode)

===
eclipse.buildId=I20060419-1640
java.version=1.5.0_06
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86

I have not been able to reproduce this error.  Andy are you still seeing this error on 3.3 M6?  I suspect there may have been an extra thread which did not shutdown and was still trying to load classes after the framework closed the bundle's classloader.  There has been some work in this area for 3.3.
